page.title: 03Brief History of the area.
page.content: The area was farmland up to the 19th century. In the 1870s the first petroleum importation began. In 1895 Kynoch and company set up a munitions factory here. A village was built for their employees and became called Kynochtown.The factory was sold in 1919 and the area reverted to farmland, but in 1923 Cory Brothers bought the site for oil refining and the village was renamed Coryton. In the 1930s oil refining ceased but storage continued of both oil and edible oil. In 1950 the site was purchased by Vacuum Oil Co.(now Mobil Oil Co.) to build a new oil refinery.By 1960 a pipeline joined the Shell and Mobil refineries for joint fire-water linkage.By 1970 an expansion programme had led to the disappearance of the village.Only the refineries remain.
